messages.message: This was just with the file browser

@Heymian this may also be related to the way I wrote this particular file… I would write the entire contents over and over again, each time with the contents having an extra line (I was just experimenting with some things). Not sure how these files are stored, but if they are stored in S3, is it possible that only the most recent version was being deleted, and S3 was caching previous versions?

i see i see. the weird this is it only fails with the python file service and not go. So looks like it might be a difference in the py vs go s3 library? not sure if there are configs for controlling the caching policy via the api, i would’ve thought that would be related to how we setup s3.
But helpful! i can try to see if i can repro. so you repeatedly copy pasted into the file browser the same file with an extra line each time?

I had a file on my local computer that would call the API for writing a file, each time writing the same contents plus one more line to log.txt in my workspace. When I was done I went to delete the file and each time it just deleted a line from log.txt
However log.txt is no longer in my workspace, honestly no idea how it went away lol
lol I deleted it when i tested it with the go fileservice :P my bad
which is why i was asking if you had other files lying around with the same problem. i’ll try to do the same thing you did.
